description.raw:
This PR is a revision of the `Components` branch which brings some improvements for the names of imported targets. It also introduces some "meta-targets" called `requested` and `all`.

I'm doing this in a separate PR and targeting the `Components` branch for two reasons:

1. To keep terminology consistent, the "main" library is being redubbed the "core" library. This means the function `ign_create_main_library(~)` will now be named `ign_create_core_library(~)`. This breaks the API of the `Components` branch, so I wanted to alert @iche033 and any other current users of Components about this before merging it. I'd rather not do a tic-toc on `ign_create_main_library(~)` since it is not in any release of `ign-cmake` yet.

2. I wanted to make it easier for reviewers to see and understand the stylistic changes that this PR is proposing, and offer feedback in case anyone has a different idea about how to name these targets.

Here's a quick overview of what this PR provides:

* Simpler target names. For example, instead of `ignition-common2::ignition-common2`, a user can simply refer to `ignition-common2::core`:

```
find_package(ignition-common2)

# Old version (still works)
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::ignition-common2)

# New version
target_link_libraries(bar PUBLIC ignition-common2::core)
```

This is even more apparent for library components, e.g. the `graphics` component:

```
find_package(ignition-common2 COMPONENTS graphics)

# Old version (still works)
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::ignition-common2-graphics)

# New version
target_link_libraries(bar PUBLIC ignition-common2::graphics)
```

* A meta-target for requested components, e.g.:

```
find_package(ignition-common2 COMPONENTS graphics av)

# Link to core, graphics, and av all at once:
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::requested)
```

* A meta-target for all components, e.g.:

```
find_package(ignition-common2 COMPONENTS all)

# Link to the core library and all its components:
target_link_libraries(foo PUBLIC ignition-common2::all)
```

I decided to make `::requested` and `::all` separate targets, that way the `::all` target implicitly ensures that all components were searched for, because the `::all` target will not exist unless you specifically request `find_package( ... COMPONENTS all)`.

I appreciate any and all feedback, including any disagreement about the `all` vs `requested` distinction, or alternative names for those targets.
